newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia Gold-price rebound vindicates mines.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia Gold-price rebound vindicates mines.

text.p: Recent firming in the gold price has vindicated Australian gold companies, most of which voluntarily took to the sidelines during the recent bout of market sales.
Analysts had said the producers faced potential losses if the slide in prices accelerated, leaving unhedged portions of production at the mercy of the market.

But bullion dealers believe a modestly stronger price coupled with forward sales positions have now placed producers in a better position financially than if they had sold off metal as prices slipped.
Light but steady demand for physical gold via Asia as seasonal buying approaches is helping sustain current gold prices, which are seen locked in a narrow trading range.
Based on technicals, local dealers put a floor price of about $378.00 on gold in the short-term and a ceiling of about $383.00 an ounce.
"They (producers) were probably a bit worried when it got down to the sort of US$377.00 level," one said.
"But because the market was dropping off a buck here, a buck there day by day, they felt it wasn't realy falling out of bed."
However, some producers, fearful that gold had a long way to go on the downside, did initiate selling programmes, mainly around the $379.00 mark.
"We we seeing bits and pieces of selling, but really very small stuff," another dealer said.
The sales were mostly chalked up to smaller producers "getting a bit of cash," he said.
However, most larger mines with substantial hedging in place also were light sellers, taking some cash to complement their higher-price forward positions.
